sentence.text: She was unprepared for it and her nervousness increased tenfold as she bustled about to get his tea .
And she acknowledged that part of her longing to be bustling about was to try and snap him out of his trance so that he could tell her where her sister was .
Ursula tossed her head in irritation and bustled across to join her .
Waitresses in pearl-buttoned black silk dresses already bustled around small circular tables set with cakes and teacups .
Mrs Blakey was already bustling about , taking butter from the fridge and putting it on the edge of the Aga to soften , taking a sliced loaf from the bread-bin .
His kitchens and dining room were open once more and he was bustling about , as jolly as Mr Fezziwig , envisaging happy hordes of merry luncheon-takers .
Jean forgot her own worries and bustled about , getting Steven his dinner out of the oven while he made himself a stiff drink at the sideboard .
Gaveston bustled about in the darkness , found a tinder , and a cresset torch flared into life .
Some shuffle and bustle along , with stiff , tense movements , head poking forward .
He hated women who bustled around doing housework .
Mrs Johnson was a cheerful woman of enormous energy who was bustling around the shop , despite a pair of huge , heavy breasts which bulged beneath her dress .
He sighed and panted with effort as he bustled around , the very picture of a harassed domestic .
Other men bustled around on the wide dock area , busying themselves .
` I know this , I know this , " muttered Luigi , bustling away .
The lights flickered on and off , illuminating others bustling back and forth , too busy in their own rush for the exits to bother with the intruders .
Fortunately Sybil came bustling back , distracting her , armed with clean linen , warm water and a pot from which wafted an ominous odour .
Evelyn bustled back into the room with her Irish whiskey .

` I thought we 'd better just have a quiet word together before we go down and see the kids on the beach , " Ben was saying as Carole bustled back into the room , carrying a tray laden with plates of cakes and biscuits .
The manager , warmer than ever now , bustled down the aisle and made a short but moving speech about power-cuts and projectors , then asked us to bear with him .
As Theda came out into the dark hall , she heard someone bustling down the stairs , and recognised Mrs Diggory 's voice .
The commotion is ignored by all others bustling down into the Earls Court bowels .
I thought , I 'm for it now , but all she said when she 'd bustled in and taken the coal from the cart , was , 'Ere yar .
Siegfried bustled in , muttered a greeting and began to pour his coffee .
The specialist bustled in , with a hand-wag ,
Caroline had bustled in with some photocopies .
Just then Alec Reid unexpectedly bustled in from the dispensary .
And with that the woman bustled off .
As Agnese bustled off , Ronni was dying to ask what connection Jeff could have with Civitavecchia .
Feeling almost overwhelmed by their hostess 's kind welcome , Laura sank down into a wide , soft couch , looking about her as Carole bustled off to fetch a cool drink .
It bumped into his foot , beeped at him , and then bustled off in the opposite direction .
` Do make yourself at home , " said Sybil hospitably and bustled off into the kitchen .
An older woman bustled over .
Nurse Bodkin bustled over to her and put her arm around her shoulder , making soothing noises and easing her into a sitting position on the bed .
Suddenly she bustled over to her sergeant and motioned him into her office .
Willi bustled over to the dresser that stretched along one side of the room and picked up a huge basket of flowers .
She bustled through from the lounge when I pressed a bell on the bar and pushed a strand of bottle blonde hair from her forehead .
She stopped her car and bustled up the pavement .
The flunkey bustled forward self-importantly .
Mr Multhrop bustled forward , but someone forestalled him with a glad cry .
A rosy-cheeked , motherly-looking woman , as small and wiry as the innkeeper , bustled forward , adding her exclamations to those of her husband .
I gave you yesterday the analogy of the home , and now we can imagine Mary bustling about the home with water for washing , for cooking and for cleaning .
They bustled to and fro across the dock and swarmed on and off the ships .
Arturo Silvio , the modelling agency 's Milan chieftain , was bustling across the floor towards her .
As people bustled around him the Doctor had harangued them frantically with all the strength that was left to him .
At that moment , they heard the noise of someone being let into the flat and a few seconds later , Dr Malcolm Anderson , the pathologist , bustled into the bedroom .
He lived for the moments when she bustled into the house , swathed in chill air , laughing and chattering about how terrible the day had been , and how glad she was to see him .
` You look worn out , " said Bedelia as she bustled into the kitchen .
They were interrupted by Janet Halstead who bustled into the room , a tight smile betraying her tiredness .
Mrs Stych , untying her apron , bustled out of the kitchen and tried not to show her despair .
Derek waited until they were standing outside , with Saturday afternoon shoppers bustling past them , before asking : ` What was Maurice right about ? "
Mr Pigdon picked up the candle which had been ready to light him to bed from a shelf in an alcove by the door , and bustled past the visitor down the hall .
She bustled to the door and her voice took on a repressive note .
She bustled to the dresser and tucked -- I saw it -- a small package deep inside the drawer .
The hostess broke away from a clique of friends and bustled towards him , arms outstretched .
A medical orderly bustled towards them .
